We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD2$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD2$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{2}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD3$.  

  So  $\blueD3$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{2}{,}\blueD3$ $\_$ $\_$

The next smallest digit is the $\purpleC3$.  The $\purpleC3$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{2}{,}\blueD3\purpleC3$  $\_$

The greatest digit is the $\greenD8$.  The  $\greenD8$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{2}{,}\blueD3\purpleC3\greenD8$ 

The smallest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{2}{,}\blueD3\purpleC3\greenD8$.
